intro: Taeniandra micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Taeniandra micrantha is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
